project.teaser: DYNAMO will result in a lean and powerful solution enabling quick, data-driven and platform-independent planning of care pathways for situations where health system functions are threatened. This solution will allow EU health care systems to build resilience and respond to...
project.objective: DYNAMO will result in a lean and powerful solution enabling quick, data-driven and platform-independent planning of care pathways for situations where health system functions are threatened. This solution will allow EU health care systems to build resilience and respond to public health threats better than they can today. DYNAMO brings together five procurers from Italy, Portugal, Spain, Greece and the United Kingdom that not only see the need for such a solution but are willing to act on it now. They will set up a collaborative demand-side initiative to create the economies of scale and early adoption cases required to build momentum for DYNAMO. As a strategic planning tool, DYNAMO will guide stakeholders in concept development, data modelling, process design and implementation planning. DYNAMO will be able to reliably inform medium-term investment planning to adapt existing processes and infrastructures (incl. IT systems). More specifically, DYNAMO will be a socio-technical system to 1. Efficiently adapt service delivery processes to shocks and structural changes 2. Share and integrate cross-sectoral data to accurately forecast outcomes and impacts of alternative pathway configurations 3. Facilitate task planning and skills matching in times of crises The Buyers Group includes health and care organisations and authorities representing diverse health care systems and settings, thus reflecting the requirements of different national health care ecosystems that DYNAMO will have to meet. Suppliers will be rigorously evaluated after each procurement phase, comprising: (I) an Open Market Consultation; (II) specification of architecture and system aligned to requirements of health and care professionals, IT planners, decision makers; (III) prototype development and testing with end-users; (IV) evaluation of implementation fidelity and tool performance, output feasibility in terms of validity and applicability of the generated pathways as well as (V) overall cost-effectiveness.
project.title: Modelling and dynamic assessment of integrated health and care pathways enhancing response capacity of health systems
project.keywords: Multi-disciplinary care pathways, digital solutions, health system resilience, rapid response, preparedness

result.title: DYNAMO high-pressure scenarios, use cases and process models
result.description: D1.3 includes reporting of high-pressure scenarios and use cases as well as service process models.

result.title: 1st Data Management Plan (DMP)
result.description: DMP based on EC Template. Incorporates results from T9.3 and reports conformance with ethical principles and DP legislation. A framework is drawn up to cover both domains, covering issues such as consent forms, submissions to the respective ethics committee at each site etc..

result.title: 1st Plan on communication, dissemination, and exploitation
result.description: The DECA, policy and branding for the consortium’s work will be developed. It includes: The development of a communication and dissemination strategy considering different audiences such as health and care provider organisations, scientific/academic, targeted companies and the general public. During M1-M5, the task develops a corporate and graphical identity for all communication material, including a website, file and graphical templates and a social media presence on Twitter, LinkedIn, ResearchGate. The DECA will be constantly updated.

result.title: Co-design and change management framework
result.description: The deliverable incorporates results from T1.1 and describes the approach to co-design and change management to guide further work in WP1 and throughout the project. It covers the structure and methodological guidance for the development of the use cases and service process models.

result.title: 1st Report on dissemination & stakeholder networking
result.description: Incorporates results from T8.3 and reports on dedicated networking activities for Follower procurers to engage in tender design, potentially testing and future procurement as well as activities to reach policy stakeholders.

result.title: Award Notice
result.description: A copy of the contract award notice published in TED: to be submitted to the granting authority, at the latest 48 days after the award of contracts. Incorporates results from T3.1, T3.2.

result.title: Prior Information Notice
result.description: The PIN for the Open Market Consultation, to be submitted to the granting authority minimum 5 days before submission for publication to OJEU at the latest 50 days before the start of the first Open Market Consultation meeting. Incorporates results from T2.1.

result.title: Methods for prototype tests
result.description: Incorporates results from T7.2 and reports on framework & (time) planning for prototype tests for Phase II.

result.title: DYNAMO evaluation framework
result.description: Incorporates results from T7.3 and T7.4 and reports the evaluation framework developed for the trial evaluation in Phase III. The framework defines the overall study design, the goals and operational endpoints of the evaluation, participant recruitment, field work, data collection, analysis, and reporting.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - DYNAMO (Modelling and dynamic assessment of integrated health and care pathways enhancing response capacity of health systems)
result.teaser: Threats to health systems such as pandemics, natural disasters or economic crises have profound implications for population health, economic progress, and social cohesion. Health system resilience – the ability to adjust to both expected and unexpected conditions while...

webItem.alternativeText: This schema graphically summarises the stepwise DYNAMO PCP-process

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: 1st DYNAMO Presentation and Guidance
result.description: Incorporates results from T8.4 and reports on guidance and an executive presentation developed for procurers on how to conduct a procurement to adopt the resulting solution. This will include all necessary requirements, estimated costs as well as benefits based on evidence collected during the project.

result.title: 2nd Report on dissemination and stakeholder networking
Tender Documents
result.description: The completed call for tender documents based on the Horizon Europe PCP/PPI model contract documents, including the contract notice, invitation to tender, procurement contracts. A draft will be made available at the latest 30 days before submission to the OJEU. Incorporates results from T1.5 and T2.3.

result.title: Challenge Brief
result.description: Common specifications are developed in a complete, coherent, and compelling Challenge Brief. Incorporates results from T1.5.

result.title: Publishable summary - Phase I
result.description: Short publishable summary of Phase I for the public. Incorporates results from T4.1, T4.2.

result.title: Tender assessment framework
result.description: Incorporates results from T7.1 and contains the scorecard and methodology used for evaluating the tenders.

result.title: Project Website
result.description: Incorporates results from T8.1. Website will act as a one-stop-shop and is the cornerstone of the dissemination strategy.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
